SB 2044 will punish association, violate freedom of assembly, and almost certainly stifle protected speech.

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

Decisions made during the biannual sessions of the North Dakota Legislature have a deep and lasting impact on our state’s people and communities. As new laws are created and others repealed or written, it’s important to ensure that these changes preserve and strengthen our constitutional rights.

That’s why I’m asking you to email Governor Burgum about Senate Bill 2044, legislation that will punish association, violate freedom of assembly, and almost certainly stifle protected speech. He needs to veto this bill.

VETO SB 2044

Existing law already prohibits trespassing and malicious destruction of property and conspiracies to commit the same. Given that, this bill’s focus on critical infrastructure facilities belies its neutral purpose – as do its excessive fines. Senate Bill 2044 will also punish organizations found to be a conspirator with those individuals found to be in violation of the new prohibitions – the literal embodiment of guilt by association.

At best, this bill is entirely unnecessary. At worst, it is meant to chill speech. Please ask Governor Burgum to veto Senate Bill 2044.

Thanks for sticking with us,

Heather Smith
Executive Director, ACLU of North Dakota
